de.mrapp.android.dialog.model

Interface ListDialogDecorator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dialog
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractListDialog, ListDialogDecorator, MaterialDialog

    public interface ListDialogDecorator
extends Dialog
    Defines the interface, a decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items, must implement.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        Dialog.Gravity

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        MATCH_PARENT, WRAP_CONTENT

      • Methods inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        getContext

    • Method Detail

      • getListView

        android.widget.ListView getListView()
        Returns the list view, which is contained by the dialog.
        Returns:
        The list view, which is contained by the dialog, as an instance of the class ListView or null, if the dialog does not show any list items or has not been shown yet

      • getListAdapter

        android.widget.ListAdapter getListAdapter()
        Returns the adapter of the list view, which is contained by the dialog.
        Returns:
        The adapter of the list view, which is contained by the dialog, as an instance of the type ListAdapter or null, if the dialog does not show any list items

      • getItemColor

        int getItemColor()
        Returns the color of the list items of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The color of the list items of the dialog as an Integer value

      • setItemColor

        void setItemColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the list items of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        color - The color, which should be set, as an Integer value

      • setItems

        void setItems(@Nullable
              java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
              @Nullable
              android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the items, which should be shown by the dialog. Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setItems

        void setItems(@ArrayRes
              int resourceId,
              @Nullable
              android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the items, which should be shown by the dialog. Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setAdapter

        void setAdapter(@Nullable
                android.widget.ListAdapter adapter,
                @Nullable
                android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the adapter, which provides the items, which should be shown by the dialog. Note, that the adapter and the attached listener are not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because they are not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-set the adapter and re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter, which should be set, as an instance of the type ListAdapter or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        void setSingleChoiceItems(@Nullable
                          java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                          int checkedItem,
                          @Nullable
                          android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once. Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        void setSingleChoiceItems(@ArrayRes
                          int resourceId,
                          int checkedItem,
                          @Nullable
                          android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once. Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        void setSingleChoiceItems(@Nullable
                          android.widget.ListAdapter adapter,
                          int checkedItem,
                          @Nullable
                          android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the adapter, which provides the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once. Note, that the adapter and the attached listener are not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because they are not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-set the adapter and re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter, which should be set, as an instance of the type ListAdapter or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        void setMultiChoiceItems(@Nullable
                         java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                         @Nullable
                         boolean[] checkedItems,
                         @Nullable
                         android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Multiple items can be selected at once. Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        void setMultiChoiceItems(@ArrayRes
                         int resourceId,
                         @Nullable
                         boolean[] checkedItems,
                         @Nullable
                         android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Multiple items can be selected at once. Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        void setMultiChoiceItems(@Nullable
                         android.widget.ListAdapter adapter,
                         @Nullable
                         boolean[] checkedItems,
                         @Nullable
                         android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the adapter, which provides the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Multiple items can be selected at once. Note, that the adapter and the attached listener are not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because they are not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-set the adapter and re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter, which should be set, as an instance of the type ListAdapter or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setOnItemSelectedListener

        void setOnItemSelectedListener(@Nullable
                               android.widget.AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when an item, which is shown by the dialog is selected. Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener or null, if no listener should be notified
